Behavior: Present information in a logical sequence
Use real world examples in teaching
Be professional in speech and actions
Allow time for questions after class
Provide a break in a two-hour or longer class
Require students to use standard English in class when they speak or write
Write notes on chalkboard while teaching
Use personal experiences as examples in teaching
Discuss ethical issues and societal norms
Require students to know instructor's name
Require students to bring books to class
Deduct points for assignments submitted late
Require that all papers be typed
Use the case study method in teaching
Assign projects requiring the use of the library
Move around in the classroom when teaching
Have students read a chapter and answer questions before teaching the content of the chapter
Require computer use for class projects
